image.altText: Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka with face blurred and handcuffs being arrested by NSW Police walking through yard

items.synopsis: The court heard Cruz Pamoana Davis-Tuka claimed his "friend" Johnson Kokozian was a passenger, not the driver, of a car involved in a crash that killed two siblings.

title.children: Man accused of lying to protect friend over deadly Sydney crash 'left the scene', court told

image.altText: A man with short dark hair pictured with his daughter whose face is pixellated

items.synopsis: The tight-knit WA community of Kellerberrin faces a long road to recovery after a father was shot dead by another well-known local resident, sparking a manhunt and police stand-off that forced the town into lockdown.

title.children: Father Terry Czernowski officially identified as victim of WA workplace fatal shooting

image.altText: Vivienne Mitchell's face and upper body is superimposed over a picture of razors that has a price tag of $43

items.synopsis: Backlash against Coles and Woolworths is swirling on social media as the supermarket giants record large profits amid a cost of living crisis. But one expert says the anger, and calls for a boycott, are unlikely to have a lasting effect.

title.children: How one Australian's 'sheer disbelief' at the rising cost of groceries reached 1.7 million shoppers

image.altText: Kobie Parfitt looks directly at the camera. She has long brown hair and is wearing a black top.

items.synopsis: Shannon Jeffrey, 34, had fatally assaulted Kobie Parfitt, 42, and dumped her body down a mineshaft. The crime went undetected for eight months. Today, she has been sentenced for manslaughter.

title.children: Woman jailed for killing Ballarat mother of four and dumping her body down a mineshaft

image.altText: a man leaning against a wall which holds a portrait of him wearing an army uniform

items.synopsis: The Australian War Memorial adds information to a plaque commemorating Corporal Ben Roberts Smith's Victoria Cross medal that reflects recent defamation court rulings over his alleged conduct in Afghanistan.

title.children: Australian War Memorial adds plaque with context of defamation case to Ben Roberts-Smith display

image.altText: An image from That '70s Show of a man with curly hair and glasses smiling, next to a photo of a man in a courtroom in a suit

items.synopsis: The star of That '70s Show is facing life in prison for raping two women, in a case which has stirred controversy around the church where he and his victims met.

title.children: 'Your sickness is no longer mine to bear': The key moments from Danny Masterson's sentencing

image.altText: A child sits in a front passenger seat using a phone with the seatbelt over their head

items.synopsis: Transport Minister Mark Bailey said the department is seeking "urgent legal advice on the swift re-issuance of incorrectly suspended licences".

title.children: 'This is our mistake': Transport department issues hundreds of 'incorrect' seatbelt penalties

image.altText: William Tyrrell's former foster parents, with faces blurred, are seen during a break at the Parramatta Local Court

items.synopsis: The couple, who cannot be identified for legal reasons, has faced a week-long hearing in Parramatta Local Court, where covert recordings of their home and car were played.

title.children: William Tyrrell's former foster parents considered 'capable and competent' by department, court told

image.altText: A composite image of Ken Hinkley and the movie Oppenheimer.

items.synopsis: As his side prepares for its biggest game of the year so far, Power coach Ken Hinkley has been drawn into a debate over the movie Oppenheimer, and whether the events it depicts are an appropriate motivating force.

title.children: Atomic bomb debate overshadows Power's AFL finals clash with Brisbane

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman sitting in an auditorium

items.synopsis: A violent rapist who drugged one of his victims is jailed for 22 years, after two women came forward to raise allegations against him.

title.children: Frances has spent years healing from trauma. Today, her rapist was jailed for two decades

image.altText: A tree-lined horizon, with a helicopter highlight by a red circle.

items.synopsis: The South Australian government is investigating its own safety protocols after a distressed deer hunter filmed himself trying to take shelter from a culling helicopter that appeared to be firing nearby.

title.children: 'We're gonna get shot': Hunters film themselves running from aerial culling helicopter on SA property

image.altText: A large cloud of smoke from a bushfire rising into the sky, over a major highway at sunset.

items.synopsis: Authorities are forecasting hotter, drier and windier conditions across Central Australia that will heighten the risk of catastrophic bushfires over summer.

title.children: Entire NT declared fire danger area until March as 'enormous' blaze closes highway

image.altText: A large number of homemade spears and edged weapons, including machetes, laid out on carpet.

items.synopsis: Ten young men have been arrested in Peppimenarti after "ongoing violent issues" in the community and 15 others are facing serious violence offences related to a separate brawl on Groote Eylandt.

title.children: Police arrest 25 people for violent offences in two remote NT communities

image.altText: A serious Indigenous man, moustache, beard, brown shirt,  stands in front of tree.

items.synopsis: Antonio Murray, who had a request for an interpreter dismissed during a trial, has had his conviction quashed over what a statewide Aboriginal language service calls a "basic human right".

title.children: Pilbara man has assault conviction overturned after regional magistrate dismissed his interpreter

image.altText: Payne wearing a red jacket and dark-rimmed glasses looks across frame.

items.synopsis: One of the Liberal Party's most senior women, and the first woman to hold the defence portfolio in Australia, will retire from politics after 26 years in parliament.

title.children: 'A grand contribution': Former minister and Liberal stalwart Marise Payne to quit politics

image.altText: Firefighters in a crane from a fire truck with some on the ground in front of a house

items.synopsis: A postman on his delivery route says he helped pull a woman from a house fire in Adelaide's CBD this morning before she was taken to hospital with minor burns to her hair and face.

title.children: 'Her hair was on fire': Postman on delivery route helps rescue woman from burning house

image.altText: A man with a jacket over his head

items.synopsis: Christopher Borg pleaded guilty to two counts of common assault and failed to have the charges dismissed on the grounds of mental health issues.

title.children: Ex-NSW police officer has sentence cut for 'entirely unprovoked' kicking of Indigenous teen

image.altText: A book page with a colourful scene on the left and grey scene on the right.

items.synopsis: Amanda Lieber noticed how distressed a mother was as she dropped her child at a hospital's school. She comforted her, and the experience led her to write about a parent's depression as seen through a child's eyes.

title.children: Amanda wrote a child's book about a parent with depression. A publisher wanted a happy ending

image.altText: Donald Trump embracing Rudy Giuliani on a dark stage

items.synopsis: Rudy Giuliani is facing a barrage of legal fees, fines, sanctions and damages related to his work helping Donald Trump try to overturn the 2020 US presidential election and other cases.

title.children: Trump hosts US$100,000 a head fundraiser to help Giuliani pay legal bills

image.altText: A woman sitting in her seat in the House of Representatives

items.synopsis: North Sydney independent MP Kylea Tink says an opposition member yelled at her aggressively in parliament on Wednesday, but Mr Dutton says he has no concerns with the account he's been given.

title.children: Peter Dutton has 'no concerns' about 'aggressive' behaviour of opposition MP

image.altText: A man walks along a road with a jacket over his shoulders and head.

items.synopsis: Greece has been slammed by "extraordinary" downpours from a weather pattern shaped like the final letter of the country's alphabet. Here is why this one was so intense.

title.children: Parts of Greece have recorded an entire year's worth of rain in 18 hours, a month after heatwaves and fire. What's caused it?

image.altText: Queen Elizabeth stands smiling and leaning on a cane next to a lit fireplace.

items.synopsis: The plans for her death were meticulous. Her lavish funeral had a code name. But when the kingdom's second Elizabethan era drew to a close, everyone suddenly seemed to be a little caught off-guard.

title.children: The inside story of the Queen's final hours, and how they foretold the first year of Charles's reign

image.altText: A woman faces side on while wearing a crown and a royal cape.

items.synopsis: The King acknowledged the anniversary of Queen Elizabeth II's death in a short statement shared on social media.

title.children: 'Recall with great affection': Charles marks first anniversary of late queen

image.altText: A protester being taken away by police at the US Open.

items.synopsis: The match is delayed for almost 50 minutes following a disruption by environmental activists inside Arthur Ashe Stadium, before Coco Gauff goes on to beat Karolína Muchová in straight sets to reach her first US Open final, where she will meet Arnya Sabalenka.

title.children: Environmental activist glues his feet to the ground as protest interrupts US Open semifinal

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD.

items.synopsis: The corporate regulator is suing Australia's largest superannuation fund for allegedly failing to address multiple superannuation accounts belonging to 90,000 customers, while the ASX is lower after a flat start. Follow live.

title.children: ASIC sues AustralianSuper over 'failure' that took $69m from the accounts of 90,000 members, ASX down

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's been a big fortnight of headlines for Qantas, and the scandals have had a major impact on the company's share price — and its value (or market capitalisation) — as a result. Four week ago on August 11, Qantas' share price closed at $6.49, giving the airline a value of $11.2 billion, based on the total number of shares issued (which is around 1.7 billion ). At the close of trade yesterday, Qantas' share price was almost a full dollar lower, at $5.57. That's a fall in the airline's share price of 15% between August 11 and September 7. Based on yesterday's closing price, Qantas is currently worth around $9.6 billion — meaning it has shed around $1.5 billion or just under 2% from its value in the past four weeks. Right now, Qantas' shares are about 0.3% lower at $5.53.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Qantas sheds $1.5 billion in value in the last four weeks

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Transport Minister Catherine King 's explanation into the decision to block Qatar Airways' additional flight request has left more questions, as the federal government remains under pressure with a Senate inquiry set to probe the issue. Critics of the decision say it's not in the national interest and will cost the economy $1 billion. Professor Rico Merkert, the chair in transport from the University of Sydney Business School, spoke to The Business host Alicia Barry about the ongoing saga that's enfulged Canberra. You can watch their full chat below:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 📺 Blocking Qatar Airways' extra flights could cost the economy $1 billion, expert says

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A Chevron spokesperson has just provided a statement in response to Chevron workers walking off the job this afternoon as their industrial dispute continues. "We have been advised by the unions that protected industrial action will not take place at our facilities until 1.00pm AWST Friday 8 September. "We will continue to work through the bargaining process as we seek outcomes that are in the interests of both employees and the company. "We will also continue to take steps to maintain safe and reliable operations in the event of disruption at our facilities."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Chevron responds to strike action to be taken by workers

children.content: A Chevron spokesperson has just provided a statement in response to Chevron workers walking off the job this afternoon as their industrial dispute continues.
"We have been advised by the unions that protected industrial action will not take place at our facilities
until 1.00pm AWST
Friday 8 September.
"We will
continue to work through the bargaining process
as we seek outcomes that are in the interests of both employees and the company.
"We will also continue to take steps to
maintain safe and reliable operations in the event of disruption
at our facilities."

image.altText: Sheep in a yard, with the focus on the face of one sheep.

items.synopsis: WA hobby farmer Rodney Swan says the distressing scenes he awoke to show the damage two dogs can do to livestock.

title.children: Dogs destroyed, owner fined after attacks kill more than 60 animals

image.altText: Composite image of a woman wearing sunglasses and a scarf, and a man in a cap and mask.

items.synopsis: A regional Victorian couple has been handed two-year community correction sentences and fined $196,000 after being found guilty of illegally selling cats and failing to provide veterinary care.

title.children: Couple who sold sick kittens from car boot hit with $196k in fines and costs for animal cruelty

image.altText: Indian Flag and ''Bharat'' Name seen in the mobile phone.

items.synopsis: Speculation is swirling that the world's most populous country could change its name, following in the recent footsteps of Türkiye.

title.children: Is India about to change its name to Bharat?

image.altText: A South Korean man opens his hands and smiles against a backdrop of a map on a wall showing Fiji and Australia.

items.synopsis: The Grace Road Church, described as a "cult", has been plagued by allegations of detaining hundreds of followers and subjecting some to ritualistic violence.

title.children: Fiji expels doomsday 'cult' members as leader slams 'heavy-handed' police action

image.altText: Hundreds of pelicans are seen across an inland lake.

items.synopsis: A group of scientists finds despite billions of dollars spent on the Murray Darling Basin Plan, many of the indicators used to measure whether the environment is receiving enough water have been getting worse.

title.children: First pelican breeding frenzy at lake since 1999 sustained by buying water from farmers, scientists say

image.altText: A health worker wears blue latex gloves and draws some coronavirus vaccine from a vial with a syringe.

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia

image.altText: storm debris

items.synopsis: Parts of Victoria are taking a battering as a strong cold front bound for Melbourne moves through the south west of the state.

title.children: Thousands without power and homes damaged as cold front batters Victoria

image.altText: A satellite image showing Australia, New Zealand and an enormous mushroom cloud from a volcanic eruption in the Pacific ocean

items.synopsis: In January 2022, a mega explosion from the Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano generated a coast-battering tsunami and vivid sunsets. Now we know the extent of the eruption's devastation below the waves.

title.children: We knew the Tongan volcanic eruption was massive. Now we know what happened on the sea floor

image.altText: Man in red jacket with light on his head

items.synopsis: The operation to rescue the experienced US cave researcher from the depths of southern Türkiye's Taurus Mountains involves teams from Bulgaria, Croatia, Hungary, Italy, Poland and Türkiye.

title.children: Race to save injured explorer 1,000 metres inside cave in Türkiye
